39.textMFS: <VL<T'You can use a circle as the restricted domain for an independent leopard.'><T'When you attach your leopard, you must also match the center so the'><T'leopard can turn correctly.'><F1FxxFFFFFFFFx20x4x>>

48.textMFS: <VL<T'You can reflect your leopard across a mirror.'><T'Reflect the circle center also, so you can tell the leopard how to turn.'>>

53.textMFS: <VL<H<T'You can rotate either leopard by any angle you want, using the '><?1xA0001<SS2<T'θ'>>><T' slider.'>><T'As before, match the center so you can tell the leopard how to turn.'>>

39.textMFS: <VL<T'You can translate your leopard by any vector you choose. (Translate the'><T'center point by the same vector so you can tell the leopard how to turn.)'><F1FxxFFFFFFFFx20x8x>>

<VL<T'You can dilate the leopard by using a slider to create a scale factor.'><T'It’s not yet possible to dilate the leopard’s size. (but coming soon...)'><T'How much faster does the dilated leopard run?'>>

116.textMFS: <VL<T'What functions were used to create this leopard dance?'><T'Use the next two pages to make your own dances.'>>

1.textMFS: <VL<T'You will have at least five leopards in your finished dance.'>>

2.textMFS: <VL<T'You will use at least two different functions to make your leopards dance.'>>

3.textMFS: <VL<T'You will begin your own dance construction with a leopard restricted to a circle.'>>

4.textMFS: <VL<T'You will inspect some prepared pages to come up with some ideas.'>>
